revised_title: Supra-conductivity and Additional Resistance in Gold Crystals
tldr: The author investigates the change of resistance in gold crystals at very low temperatures in a magnetic field. They discovered that the resistance increases as the square of the magnetic field, and in strong fields, it approaches a linear law. The author's hypothesis suggests that the disturbance produced by the structural imperfection of the lattice increases the specific resistance of an ideal metal by a value called the "additional resistance." This research supports the idea of supra-conductivity and provides insight into the behavior of metals under extreme conditions.
